trans-unit.source: Role Based Access Control in Mobile Services and Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Role Based Access Control in Mobile Services and Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Roles-based access control (RBAC) is the practice of assigning permissions to roles that your users can hold.
trans-unit.target: Roles-based access control (RBAC) is the practice of assigning permissions to roles that your users can hold.

trans-unit.source: It nicely defines boundaries on what certain classes of users can and cannot do.
trans-unit.target: It nicely defines boundaries on what certain classes of users can and cannot do.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will walk you through how to add basic RBAC to Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will walk you through how to add basic RBAC to Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will demonstrate role based access control, checking each user's membership to a Sales group defined in the Azure Active Directory (AAD).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will demonstrate role based access control, checking each user's membership to a Sales group defined in the Azure Active Directory (AAD).

trans-unit.source: The access check will be done with .NET Mobile Service backend using the [Graph REST API] for Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The access check will be done with .NET Mobile Service backend using the [Graph REST API] for Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Only users who belong to the Sales group will be allowed to query the data.
trans-unit.target: Only users who belong to the Sales group will be allowed to query the data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication to include authorization practices.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication to include authorization practices.
